channel.title: ~Fixing Some SilabSoft Errors~
channel.description:
I am here to help a few people out that are getting errors when they open MoparScape or SilabSoft.
ERROR: Ok the first error people get is, [code]Some Strange Error Has Occured Please Tell SilabSoft About It[/code] With some other stuff with it.
SOLUTION: This is easy, download MoparScape (old) and Install it agina, Run it let it load till the log in screen then close MoparScape then open SilabSoft back up.
Here is a link to download MoparScape ~ [url=http://www.moparisthebest.com/moparscape.html]http://www.moparisthebest.com/moparscape.html[/url]
Make sure to click the second "Here" as the others give you an error.
----
ERROR: The second error that people get is something like this. [code]Javac is not recognized as an external or internal press any key to continue...[/code] Something along the lines of that anyway.
SOLUTION: Ok, this is a bit tricky. Go to My Computer - Local Disk (C:) - Program Files - Java
When you are there make sure you have jdk1.6.0_03 and jre1.6.0_03, if you do not have these please download them.
After you have download them Right Click on My Computer, Click on Properties, Go to the Advanced Section, Click on Environmentable Variables and then see if you have 2 things named PATH and CLASSPATH in the top box. if you don't Create a new one name it CLASSPATH and for the Variable add this... [code]CLASSPATH=C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_03\bin;%CLASSPATH%;[/code]
Then make another new one named PATH and put this inside the Variable... [code]C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_03\bin[/code]
Now if you already had PATH and CLASSPATH in the top box just double click on it and change the Variables to what is ment to go for each CLASSPATH and PATH shown above.
----
Now if there is any other errors you are getting, please copy and paste it into a rpely and I will work on the soltuon right away for you. :)
I hope I have helped people out getting errors to fix them. If there is anyone needing helpe with SilabSoft items, go to my guide on how to fix that. ;)
Thankyou,
-Im A Nugget

item.title: ~Fixing Some SilabSoft Errors~
item.dc:creator: @soadfreek409 soadfreek409
item.description:
@soadfreek409 wrote:

It loads all fine, but while everything is going crazy on the cmd prompt window, it stops and says: java.io.FileNotFoundException: c:\windows\.mpr_file_store_32\silabdat_0.idx (The system cannot find the file specified) Error: loaderror Connectiong to Update Server 60

And the client window is black and says:

Sorry, an error has occured whilst loading RuneScape


To fix this try the following (in order):


1. Try closing ALL open web-browser windows, and reloading..

ect.........................

Please help if you can.

Read full topic

item.title: ~Fixing Some SilabSoft Errors~
item.dc:creator: @Im_A_Nugget Im A Nugget
item.description:
@Im_A_Nugget wrote:

I am here to help a few people out that are getting errors when they open MoparScape or SilabSoft.

ERROR:
Ok the first error people get is, Some Strange Error Has Occured Please Tell SilabSoft About It With some other stuff with it.

SOLUTION:
This is easy, download MoparScape (old) and Install it agina, Run it let it load till the log in screen then close MoparScape then open SilabSoft back up.

Here is a link to download MoparScape ~ http://www.moparisthebest.com/moparscape.html

Make sure to click the second “Here” as the others give you an error.

ERROR:
The second error that people get is something like this. Javac is not recognized as an external or internal press any key to continue...
Something along the lines of that anyway.

SOLUTION:
Ok, this is a bit tricky. Go to My Computer - Local Disk (C:) - Program Files - Java

When you are there make sure you have jdk1.6.0_03 and jre1.6.0_03, if you do not have these please download them.

After you have download them Right Click on My Computer, Click on Properties, Go to the Advanced Section, Click on Environmentable Variables and then see if you have 2 things named PATH and CLASSPATH in the top box. if you don’t Create a new one name it CLASSPATH and for the Variable add this…

CLASSPATH=C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_03\bin;%CLASSPATH%;

Then make another new one named PATH and put this inside the Variable…

C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_03\bin

Now if you already had PATH and CLASSPATH in the top box just double click on it and change the Variables to what is ment to go for each CLASSPATH and PATH shown above.

Now if there is any other errors you are getting, please copy and paste it into a rpely and I will work on the soltuon right away for you.

I hope I have helped people out getting errors to fix them. If there is anyone needing helpe with SilabSoft items, go to my guide on how to fix that.

Thankyou,

-Im A Nugget
